tool_description: MapQuasar is a cutting-edge geocoding API that provides powerful mapping and location-based services. With lightning-fast performance and precise accuracy, MapQuasar offers a comprehensive suite of endpoints to meet all your geolocation needs. From geocoding and reverse geocoding to distance calculations and route planning, MapQuasar empowers developers to build innovative location-aware applications with ease. Its unique name reflects its advanced technology and stellar performance, making i...
name: MapQuasar
title: MapQuasar

api_list.name: calculateDistance
api_list.description: The calculateDistance endpoint calculates the distance between two sets of latitude and longitude coordinates using the Vincenty formula, which provides accurate results over long distances on the Earth's surface. This endpoint accepts four parameters: the latitude and longitude coordinates of two points and the desired unit of measurement (kilometers, miles, or nautical miles). It computes the distance between the two points and returns the result in the specified unit of measurement. This functionality is useful for applications that require distance calculations, such as mapping, navigation, logistics, and geospatial analysis.

api_list.name: reverseGeocode
api_list.description: The reverseGeocode endpoint performs the reverse operation of the geocodeAddress endpoint. It takes latitude and longitude coordinates as input and returns a human-readable address corresponding to those coordinates. This endpoint is valuable for applications that need to provide location context to users based on their geographical coordinates. It enables users to understand their current or selected location in familiar terms, such as street addresses, cities, and countries. This functionality is essential for navigation, location-based services, and mapping applications.

api_list.name: geocodeAddress
api_list.description: The geocodeAddress endpoint allows users to convert a human-readable address into geographical coordinates (latitude and longitude). This endpoint accepts an address as input and returns the corresponding latitude and longitude coordinates, enabling applications to accurately pinpoint locations on a map. It is particularly useful for mapping applications, location-based services, and geospatial analysis.
